sense.name: to improve or elevate a rating or evaluation
sense.commentary: Syntax is: NP1[agent] UPGRADE NP2[abstract] (PP of NP3)
sense.examples: Her opinion of the place upgraded as soon as she saw the old movie theater. James needs to upgrade his ideas about people from that area. Despite those worries, Urban upgraded his rating on the company. The President has upgraded the terror alert to level red.

sense.name: obtain more recent equipment; make up-to-date
sense.commentary: Syntax is: NP1[agent] UPGRADE NP2[concrete] (PP to NP3) NP1[agent] UPGRADE NP2[theme] (PP to NP3)
sense.examples: The company finally decided to upgrade all of its software. She felt it was time to upgrade to a newer Harley Davidson. I need to upgrade my video card so my games will go faster. We need to upgrade the power plant to comply with 2007 safety standards.

sense.name: promote or give a higher position
sense.commentary: Syntax includes: NP1[agent] UPGRADE NP2[patient] (PP[position]) NP1[agent] UPGRADE NP2[human] (PP[position]) Note: Involves personal advancement of an individual (or an individual's function), not the improvement of an object or person's well-being/condition.
sense.examples: After six months her status was upgraded to Technician II. My position was upgraded after ten years of hard work.

sense.name: improve travel conditions
sense.examples: We upgraded our entire travel itenerary with the help of our travel agent. The airline was able to upgrade me to First Class just before the flight. I'm sorry the flight is full, we will not be able to upgrade your seat.
